intro: Lobelia circaeoides, commonly known as the Cape lobelia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty air and strong winds. Lobelia circaeoides is a perennial herb that produces showy blooms from late spring to early summer.
